subclusters.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
Hormesis and Redox Signaling Modulation of Free Radical Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondria as both source and target of ROS damage driving aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative stress as central to aging.
Highlights age-related increase in mitochondrial ROS production as causal for aging.
Describes mitochondrial dysfunction and ROS accumulation causing brain aging and neurodegeneration.
Links ROS generation rate and lifespan, with antioxidant interventions modulating mitochondrial ROS damage.
Connects mitochondrial ROS production, dietary restriction, and oxidative damage in aging and tumorigenesis.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production rate influencing aging and longevity in bats.
Describes ROS-mediated oxidative damage accumulation and antioxidant defense correlation with lifespan.
Details mitochondrial ROS production and decline in antioxidant defenses driving aging.
Focuses on mitochondrial redox damage and antioxidant intervention in free radical aging theory.
Examines mitochondrial ROS production as determinant of aging rate and lifespan.
Emphasizes mitochondrial superoxide radicals and intrinsic aging process driven by free radical damage.
Describes adaptive evolution of mitochondrial cytochrome b reducing ROS generation to extend longevity.
Links ROS from mitochondrial metabolism and antioxidant defenses to lifespan differences in marine invertebrates.
Focuses on mitochondrial SOD polymorphisms affecting ROS balance and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights antioxidant enzymes like catalase and their modulation by hormones affecting oxidative damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on antioxidant and repair systems removing oxidative damage and their decline with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes peroxiredoxins as antioxidants protecting genome from ROS and their inactivation contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on methionine sulfoxide reductases repairing oxidized proteins and their differential effects on lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes PaMTH1 enzyme methylating flavonoids to prevent metal-dependent ROS generation and oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes role of antioxidants, early nutrition, and trade-offs in antioxidant defense affecting aging.
Describes lipid peroxidation as oxidative damage marker modulated by caloric restriction affecting aging.
Focuses on free radical-induced lipid peroxidation damaging membranes and driving aging.
Links oxidative damage accumulation and antioxidant role in stationary-phase bacterial aging model.
Focuses on protein oxidation and species differences in oxidative damage correlating with lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Repair Systems in Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative damage accumulation to proteins and decline in antioxidant defenses with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Redox Signaling Modulation of Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on hormesis, vitagenes, and dietary antioxidants modulating oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormesis and Redox Signaling Modulation of Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Revises free radical theory emphasizing redox signaling by controlled ROS rather than damage as aging cause.
